revised_title: Influence of Stress Rate and Reversal on the Fatigue of Metals
tldr: This study investigates the effects of stress rate and reversal on the fatigue of metals using X-ray diffraction and metallographic examinations. The research shows that rapid alternating stress suppresses widespread disorientation in metal grains, while slow alternating stress causes extensive disorientation. The findings have implications for understanding the failure of metals by fatigue.
